ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I have difficulty controlling my thoughts
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I find it hard to switch my thoughts off
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I have two or more different thoughts going on at the same time
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: My thoughts are disorganized and all over the place
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: My thoughts are on the go all the time
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: Because my mind is on the go at bedtime, I have difficulty falling off to sleep
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I experience ceaseless mental activity
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I find it difficult to think about one thing without another thought entering my mind
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I find my thoughts are distracting and prevent me from focusing on what I am doing
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I try to distract myself from my thoughts by doing something else or listening to music
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I have difficulty slowing my thoughts down and focusing on one thing at a time
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I find it difficult to think about one thing without another thought entering my mind
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I find myself flitting back and forth between thoughts
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I use alcohol or other drugs to slow down my thoughts and stop constant mental chatter
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly

ElementDescription: I can only focus my thoughts on one thing at a time with considerable effort
Notes: 0=Not at all or rarely; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Nearly all of the time or constantly
